The biggest issues with OW2 (and blizzard)

Ranked:
- blizzard artificially increases the grind to higher ranks by forcing 50% winrate for everyone for more "player engagement," giving you leavers, griefers and AFKs or just extremely bad players resulting in unwinnable games half of the time.
- sometimes they won't even count your wins if your winrate somehow manages to go too positive.
- their philosophy consists of: "more playtime = more potential in-game purchases made" and "more playtime = better player engagement."
- nearly every game of ranked is a hard stomp one way or the other and because of this, games are never balanced.
- to this day nobody has EVER actually been punished for griefing and blatantly throwing in ranked.
- there has never been a rank reset so 99% of the current player base will always remain boosted far beyond their real skill.
- because of these reasons nobody cares about winning and queues into ranked just to waste time.

Balancing:
- blizzard keeps buffing their select favorite characters (genji, echo, ana, kiriko, sombra, d.va, doomfist, orisa etc.) while nerfing mccree and widowmaker (and up until two patches ago soldier (nerfed again in the latest)) in every patch even though they are borderline unusable anywhere.
- the whole game favors random high burst damage spam while leaving the high skill hitscan characters not being able to keep up (other than ashe, aka the mccree replacement, because she's a strong woman and she needs to be good.)
- ana has been and will always be the biggest problem character in the whole game ever since she got released.
- supports deal more damage and get kills easier than most dps.
- tanks are gods and can one shot anyone no matter how bad you are at the game.

The abandoning of the old vision:
- scummy practices of the usual live-service garbage.
- can't unlock everything for free like how you used to.
- their main focus is trying their hardest to milk the players of their money.
- blizzard never fulfilling their promises because of their incompetence.
- the idea in their hero balancing is to make their original player base (aka the old fps players) not want to play the game, because fps players are toxic.
- tanks are the main characters instead of the dps.

从前，我养了一只猫，我有十块钱，会用八块钱给它买吃的，经常给它洗澡，它也很粘我。

后来，我带它出去玩，路人觉得它很可爱，他们给它喂猫粮，火腿肠，我很不开心，因为它是我的。我想把它抱回家，可是它挣脱我，冲着给它好吃的人喵喵，我抱了几次他都不跟我走，还挠伤了我，于是我转身就走了.....

后来，偶然在路上遇到了它，它身上脏兮兮的。路人们只会给它好吃的，陪它玩玩，却不会带它回家，给它洗澡。它看到我后就跟着我回家，我把它关在了门外，它在门外喵喵地叫着，叫的我很难受，
可是我不会再要它了

Team Fortress 2 is a 2007 multiplayer first-person shooter game developed and published by Valve Corporation. It is the sequel to the 1996 Team Fortress mod for Quake and its 1999 remake, Team Fortress Classic. The game was released in October 2007 as part of The Orange Box for Windows and the Xbox 360, and ported to the PlayStation 3 in December 2007.[1][2] It was released as a standalone game for Windows in April 2008, and updated to support Mac OS X in June 2010 and Linux in February 2013. It is distributed online through Valve's digital retailer Steam, with Electronic Arts managing retail and console editions.

作为守望先锋的续作，《守望先锋2》在发布前引发了无数的期待与热议。然而，实际上，这款游戏却让许多玩家感到失望。以下是我对守望先锋2的差评：

首先，守望先锋2在游戏玩法方面几乎没有太多的创新。与继任者相比，游戏中的新角色和新地图并没有给人带来新鲜感。相反，它只是对原版中的内容进行了稍微的修改和升级，让人感觉像是玩了一个新地图包而已。这对于已经沉迷于原版的玩家来说是个巨大的失望。

其次，守望先锋2的多人游戏模式显得相当单调乏味。游戏中的各种模式与原版并没有太多区别，战斗依然是在一些暴力冲突的场景中进行，缺乏新颖的挑战和策略性玩法。这使得游戏很快就变得单调乏味，让人感到索然无味。

此外，守望先锋2的开发商对于玩家的反馈并没有给予足够的重视。游戏中存在一些明显的BUG和平衡性问题，然而，开发团队并没有在合理的时间内进行修复和优化。这让许多玩家感到愤怒和失望，觉得自己的声音并没有被重视。

最后，守望先锋2的商业模式也引起了不少争议。游戏中存在着大量的付费内容和游戏内购买，这让人感觉游戏过于商业化，缺乏对玩家的尊重。这也使得一些原本对续作抱有期待的玩家决定放弃这款游戏。

总的来说，守望先锋2在在创新性、游戏玩法、对玩家反馈的处理以及商业模式等方面都存在着明显的不足。这使得许多玩家感到失望，认为它失去了原版的魅力和刺激。因此，我给守望先锋2打差评。
As the sequel to Overwatch, Overwatch 2 has aroused numerous expectations and hot discussions before its release. In reality, however, the game left many players disappointed. Here's my bad review of Overwatch 2:

First of all, Overwatch 2 doesn't have much innovation in terms of gameplay. New characters and new maps in the game don't feel fresh compared to their successors. Instead, it's only slightly modified and upgraded from the original, making it feel like you're playing a new map pack. This was a huge disappointment for those who had become addicted to the original.

Second, Overwatch 2's multiplayer mode is pretty boring. The various modes in the game are not much different from the original, and the battles are still conducted in some violent scenes, and there is a lack of novel challenges and strategic gameplay. This makes the game quickly become monotonous and uninteresting.

In addition, the developers of Overwatch 2 did not pay enough attention to player feedback. There were some obvious bugs and balance issues in the game, however, the development team did not fix and optimize it in a reasonable amount of time. This left many players angry and disappointed, feeling that their voices were not being heard.

Finally, Overwatch 2's business model has caused a lot of controversy. There is a lot of paid content and in-game purchases, which makes the game feel too commercial and lacks respect for the player. This also caused some players who had been looking forward to the sequel to decide to abandon the game.

Overall, Overwatch 2 has significant shortcomings in terms of innovation, gameplay, handling of player feedback, and business model. This left many players disappointed, feeling that it lost the charm and excitement of the original. Therefore, I give Overwatch 2 a bad review.

I've been an Overwatch player since it launched back in 2016. And for those who have never heard of Overwatch before coming to this steam page, I'll just give you the TL;DR: Overwatch 2 is exactly the same as Overwatch 1 - a team-based FPS shooter where you fight to capture a point or push a payload. For the most part, it's Overwatch 1 if it got nonstop updates for 7 years.

If you played Overwatch 1 like I did for many years, you might like this. But for the vast majority of people who either only stuck around with Overwatch till 2017 or never touched the game at all, this is an easy one to skip. I'm not going to get into the whole FtP system or the horrendous monetization system. The gist of it is that it's greedy beyond belief and I would have happily paid full box price for a game like this, like I did for OW1. But there are better people to talk about it than me, and it's a bigger problem in the just Overwatch. I'm not saying there can't be better FtP models, but I'd rather have not use this model at all. Let's not pretend Blizz, Respawn, Epic Games or EA are small indie companies now...

I personally think Overwatch is one of the most interesting IPs ever made and I clearly like it enough to still play it. But it is not being managed well - to say the least. Please don't throw the actual developers under the bus, like a lot of people seem to; this isn't a World of Warcraft situation where the devs are actual pieces of shit. Most of the issues you heard about Blizzard came from the management team, HR, and again, the WoW team. The OW team - AKA Team 4 - has just been trying to do their job. It just sucks that their bosses are assholes. Don't just read headlines and hearsay and take it at face value. A vast majority of Team 4 still wanted to try and fulfill that PvE promise but thanks to insufficient resources, it was never going to happen. I'm obviously oversimplifying a bit for brevity, but I encourage you to read Aaron Keller's blog on Overwatch development plan, describing it as "crawl, walk, run". 

Don't get me wrong, the PvE promise being broken does piss me off, especially as a veteran player. But I'm not going to tell you that it was the developers' choice because it just wasn't. Put it this way; if Overwatch was some other company's IP from the start, it might have had a better future. Blizzard is infamous for creating massive hit IPs that only last a few years. But if the IP is great, if the art, story, music and the entire universe surrounding a game is fantastic, which it is for Overwatch, this tells me that there are talented people who genuinely care about this game. It just sucks that bosses do not.

This game only gets played as there are very little alternatives when it comes to hero based shooters. It rides the coat-tails of those who created the original game in 2016 and has only gone down hill since then. The battle pass system, lacklustre paid PvE and overall updates have torpedoed the potential of overwatch. The artists and writers behind the game have carried this franchise since 2016, with a majority of other employees at blizzard having no clue what makes overwatch successful. This game would require half the team be fired and replaced to actually be any good. I recommend that you don't get attached to this style of game before it's too late, Microsoft will not fix this game.

[h1] TL;DR (En résumé) : [/h1]
L'accès aux héros est complexe et même coûteux. Les nouvelles sorties de personnage s'accompagnent également de nombreux bugs qui prennent parfois une année à être patch (référence au "swift-step" de Kiriko).
Malgré tout, Overwatch 2 offre encore des moments de divertissement, mais je ne peux que le recommander de manière occasionnelle.
Blizzard n'est pas réputé pour récompenser la patience et l'investissement de ses joueurs, et le modèle économique est savamment orchestré pour vous encourager à céder à sa tentation.

[h1] 一 Les autres avis négatifs ne vous ont pas convaincus ? [/h1]
一 “Oh, la communauté d'Overwatch est vraiment négative, les critiques sont bien trop influencées par des déceptions, que moi, en tant que nouveau joueur, je ne partage pas...”
Est-ce là votre point de vue ? Parfait ! Voici mon analyse et mon opinion en excluant toute considération de mes attentes personnelles ainsi que des promesses formulées par l'équipe de développement d'Overwatch.

[b] ⬥ Jouez en équipe maintenant et plongez au cœur de l’action! [/b]
Overwatch 2, référence du FPS par équipe, met en scène une galerie de personnages en constante évolution dans un futur résolument optimiste !
Cependant, dès votre arrivé dans le jeu, vous constaterez rapidement que votre accès à la plupart de ces personnages est restreint.
Si vous créez un nouveau compte, vous devrez déverrouiller ces héros un par un, cependant, les possesseurs d'Overwatch auront toujours un accès "gratuit" aux 34 héros d'origine. (C'est-à-dire ceux ayant été ajoutés au jeu avant Overwatch 2)

[b] ⬥ Plusieurs méthodes sont à votre disposition pour débloquer ces personnages ! [/b]
[list]
    [*]Grâce à des défis ou des challenges, en optant pour le passe de combat (le nouveau héros de la saison est accessible au niveau 45 pour ceux resteront Free-To-Play).
    [*]Alternativement, vous pouvez les acheter individuellement pour 900 crédits chacun (équivalant à 9 € l'unité).
[/list]

[b] ⬥ L'entreprise doit mettre en place un moyen de maintenir l'engagement des joueurs. [/b]
Je me permets de citer un article de TheVerge datant de Sep 15, 2022: [i]“The heroes are the single most engaging content that we have in the game,”[/i] Kong continued. [i]“And as we designed this model, it seemed to be a very strong fit, to put those heroes into our new engagement systems.”[/i]

[b] ⬥ Sur Overwatch, l'accès aux héros étaient gratuits. [/b]
Jeff Kaplan avait même annoncé que les héros ne seraient jamais vendus dans des DLCs.
Ainsi, en restreignant l'accès aux héros en fonction de la progression du passe de combat, Blizzard incite les joueurs à persévérer dans l'espoir qu'ils dépensent occasionnellement quelques dollars/euros ici et là pour faciliter cette progression ou acheter de nouveaux objets premium.

Cette transition vers un modèle économique plus agressif s'inscrit de manière insidieuse dans la tendance actuelle des décisions prises par Blizzard, privilégiant la maximisation des revenus au détriment de la qualité du produit final et des engagements antérieurs.

Prenons un bref instant pour nous éloigner d'Overwatch 2 et nous informer sur les revenus générés par Diablo Immortal. Nous découvrons alors que ce dernier continue de générer plus d'un million de dollars par jour, malgré les critiques à l'encontre de son modèle de microtransactions.

[h1] 一 Mais alors... Quelle trajectoire Overwatch 2 est-il en train de suivre ? [/h1]
Elle semble se diriger vers la maximisation des revenus avant la fermeture des serveurs.

Cette affirmation peut être vérifiée en observant la qualité du contenu offert à travers le passe de combat.
[list]
    [*]Les nouvelles animations d'entrée en scène se contentent du minimum syndical. Il suffit de comparer, par exemple, les animations d'entrée en scène de Zenyatta (qui datent de 2016) avec celles d'Illari (le tout nouveau héros de support de cette saison).
    [*]Il y a beaucoup plus de nouveaux objets cosmétiques que de contenu PvE ajouté cette saison. (Cela survient alors que l'objectif principal de cette saison était précisément de mettre en avant le mode PvE, qui avait grandement souffert en raison de promesses non tenues.)
[/list]

一 En résumé, pour comprendre l'orientation d'une franchise, il suffit de considérer le tarif et le contenu inclus dans ses DLCs. En tant que joueur, vous méritez un traitement bien plus respectueux que celui d'un simple consommateur.

Vous accordez à ce jeu l'honneur suprême de votre temps, de votre passion et de votre engagement.
Que cet engagement précieux ne soit pas récompensé par un modèle économique visant à vous délester de vos derniers euros.
Une fois que vous serez tombé dans le piège de ce modèle, vous risquerez davantage d'y succomber à nouveau.
